hook.text: An employee is talented but disengaged. She has a good salary but no say in her projects. Money isn't the problem.

buildup.text: SDT says humans need three things: autonomy (choice), competence (mastery), and relatedness (belonging).

discovery.text: When all three are met, people thrive. Remove any one and motivation crumbles, no matter how high the pay.

twist.text: Micromanagement kills autonomy. Impossible goals kill competence. Isolation kills relatedness. Leaders often do all 3.

climax.text: Audit your team: does each person have choice, growth, and belonging? Fix the weakest link first. Energy will follow.

punchline.text: People don't need motivation. They need the conditions for it.

quiz.question: What are the three needs in Self-Determination Theory?
